in·dors·ing.definition: [Anglo-Frenchand Medieval Latin, both ultimately from Latinon +back]

1.definition: to write on the back ofto sign one's name as payee on the back of (an instrument) in order to receive the cash or credit represented on the face [ a check]

2.definition: to inscribe (as one's signature or a notation accompanied by one's signature) on an instrument (as a note or bill) esp. to transfer or guarantee it

3.definition: to transfer (an instrument) to another by inscribing one's signature [assume that payeea note to creditor as security for a debt ""]
3.s: a note to creditor as security for a debt "

4.definition: to inscribe (as an official document) with a notation (as of date or title)
